attributes.comment:
USCIS delivers poor customer service for its customers, overcharges already, and
delivers a very poor experience to those in need of their service. It should be
pointed out that its customers are taxpayers and any increase in rates is
essentially an increase in taxes - in exchange for poor service. I can be
fingerprinted for free by my local police department, but this is not good
enough for USCIS! They apparently have the need for special fingerprints... more
special than the free fingerprints that I need to have taken yearly for other
FBI clearances related to my job. How about this: quit trying to make a profit,
treat taxpayers like humans, shorten your wait times, shorten the wait for
paperwork, stop being domineering and authoritative, get rid of Barney Fife with
the metal detector at the door (especially followed by the bullet-proof glass
windows; I mean, is he that bad at searching that you still need physically
separated from the people that you serve), and finally, instead of raising rates
for prints - allow people to get them wherever they please! The USCIS is an
example of everything that is wrong with the federal government!
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By John W. Johnston, III
